DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The HLA-B gene plays a role in both immune responses and histocompatibility processes._Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude._Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in DNA sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.[manually curated]
